wp4.compare.models.organ¶

Functions

validate_between_1900_2050(date)
validate_not_in_future(date)

Classes

AllocatableOrganManager() Get only the Organs that are available for allocation, which means they’re Unallocated (not deliberately), Randomised, and still Transplantable (but not necessarily a completed P form).
ClosedOrganManager() Get only the Organs that have had completed outcomes.
Donor(*args, **kwargs) Extension of an OrganPerson record (via OneToOne link for good ORM/DB management) to capture
MaxValueValidator(limit_value[, message])
MinValueValidator(limit_value[, message])
OpenOrganManager() Get only the Organs that are open for transplantation, which means they’ve one or more allocations, and have not had their form closed (either by allocation outside of project area, or completed form).
Organ(*args, **kwargs) The focus of the trial, specifically a Kidney.
PerfusionFile(*args, **kwargs) Early plans talked about collecting the data file from each machine after each transplant to provide extra data, however this has been shelved as a concept presently.
PerfusionMachine(*args, **kwargs) Helper class for device accountability.
ProcurementResource(*args, **kwargs) Repeatable list of resources used during organ extraction.
User(*args, **kwargs) Users within the Django authentication system are represented by this model.
VersionControlModel(*args, **kwargs) Internal common attributes to aide system auditing of records

Exceptions

ValidationError(message[, code, params]) An error while validating data.
class wp4.compare.models.organ.ClosedOrganManager[source]¶

Get only the Organs that have had completed outcomes. These are:

  • Organ.not_allocated_reason has a value... which results in...
  • Recipient.transplantation_form_completed is True

So wait, what about if the Organ is allocated to a non project site hospital, doesn’t that also close the case? Yes, yes it does, and we can more trivially cover this by writing a message into not_allocated_reason of $MESSAGE$, and then setting the transplantation_form_completed flag

get_queryset()[source]¶

Filter Organs results by only returning where transplantation_form_completed=True

Returns:Queryset
class wp4.compare.models.organ.AllocatableOrganManager[source]¶

Get only the Organs that are available for allocation, which means they’re Unallocated (not deliberately), Randomised, and still Transplantable (but not necessarily a completed P form).

get_queryset()[source]¶

Filter Organ results by organallocation__isnull=True AND transplantable=True, excluding results where preservation=PRESERVATION_NOT_SET OR transplantation_form_completed=True

Returns:Queryset
class wp4.compare.models.organ.OpenOrganManager[source]¶

Get only the Organs that are open for transplantation, which means they’ve one or more allocations, and have not had their form closed (either by allocation outside of project area, or completed form).

get_queryset()[source]¶

Filter Organ results by transplantable=True, excluding results where transplantation_form_completed=True OR organallocation__isnull=True OR preservation=PRESERVATION_NOT_SET

Returns:Queryset
class wp4.compare.models.organ.Organ(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The focus of the trial, specifically a Kidney.

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • donor_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “donor” - Internal link to the Donor
  • location (django.db.models.CharField) – “OR01 kidney location”
  • not_allocated_reason (django.db.models.CharField) – “OR31 not transplantable because”
  • admin_notes (django.db.models.TextField) – “DO50 Admin notes”
  • transplantation_notes (django.db.models.TextField) – “DO51 Transplantation notes”
  • transplantation_form_completed (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “transplantation form completed” - Internal value to flag when technician thinks the form is complete
  • removal (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “OR02 time out” - Date must be fall within 1900-2050, and not be in the future
  • renal_arteries (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OR03 number of renal arteries” - Number of arteries must be in range 0-5
  • graft_damage (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OR04 renal graft damage”
  • graft_damage_other (django.db.models.CharField) – “OR05 other damage done”
  • washout_perfusion (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OR06 perfusion characteristics”
  • transplantable (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR07 is transplantable” - OR07h This answer can be amended after randomisation and saving of the form if necessary
  • not_transplantable_reason (django.db.models.CharField) – “OR08 not transplantable because”
  • preservation (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “preservation”
  • perfusion_possible (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR09 machine perfusion possible?”
  • perfusion_not_possible_because (django.db.models.CharField) – “OR10 not possible because”
  • perfusion_started (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “OR11 machine perfusion” - Date must be fall within 1900-2050, and not be in the future
  • patch_holder (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OR12 used patch holder”
  • artificial_patch_used (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR13 artificial patch used”
  • artificial_patch_size (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OR14 artificial patch size”
  • artificial_patch_number (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “OR15 number of patches”
  • oxygen_bottle_full (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR16 is oxygen bottle full”
  • oxygen_bottle_open (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR17 oxygen bottle opened”
  • oxygen_bottle_changed (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR18 oxygen bottle changed”
  • oxygen_bottle_changed_at (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “OR19 oxygen bottle changed at” - Date must be fall within 1900-2050, and not be in the future
  • oxygen_bottle_changed_at_unknown (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “oxygen bottle changed at unknown” - Internal unknown flag
  • ice_container_replenished (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR20 ice container replenished”
  • ice_container_replenished_at (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “OR21 ice container replenished at” - Date must be fall within 1900-2050, and not be in the future
  • ice_container_replenished_at_unknown (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “ice container replenished at unknown” - Internal unknown flag
  • perfusate_measurable (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “OR22 perfusate measurable”
  • perfusate_measure (django.db.models.FloatField) – “OR23 value pO2”
  • perfusion_machine_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “OR24 perfusion machine”
  • perfusion_file_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “OR25 machine file”

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

clean()[source]¶

Clears the following fields of data if their corresponding unknown flag is set to True

  • oxygen_bottle_changed_at
  • ice_container_replenished_at

Error if:

  • transplantable is False, and not_transplantable_reason is empty (ORv01)
  • perfusion_possible is False, and perfusion_not_possible_because is empty (ORv02)
  • perfusion_possible is True, and perfusion_started is not set (ORv03)
safe_recipient¶

Helper method to return either the related Recipient record, or a safe value of None, without the drama of exceptions when it doesn’t exist

Return type:wp4.compare.models.transplantation.Recipient
trial_id¶

Returns the Donor Trial ID combined with the Location (L or R) for the Organ

Returns:‘WP4cctnns’
Return type:str
is_allocated¶

Allocation status

Determine if an organ has been allocated. Allocated means:

  • To a recipient at a project site
  • Final allocation is to a non-project site
Returns:True, if either of those criteria are met
Return type:bool
explain_is_allocated¶

Allocation status description – An explanation as to the allocation status for this organ

Returns:Message describing status of allocation
Return type:str
explain_closed_status¶

Work out why this form was closed, and display a suitable summary message

NOT IMPLEMENTED (yet)

Returns:Message describing the likely cause for the form being closed
Return type:str
reallocation_count¶

Counts the number of organ allocations where reallocated is true

Returns:Count of reallocations
Return type:int
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception Organ.MultipleObjectsReturned¶
Organ.adverseevent_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class wp4.compare.models.organ.ProcurementResource(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Repeatable list of resources used during organ extraction. Primarily distinguished by the type.

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • organ_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “PR01 related kidney”
  • type (django.db.models.CharField) – “PR02 resource used”
  • lot_number (django.db.models.CharField) – “PR03 lot number”
  • expiry_date (django.db.models.DateField) – “PR04 expiry date”
  • expiry_date_unknown (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “expiry date unknown” - Internal unknown flag
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on” - Internal value
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - Internal User link
